section.title: Installing and Configuring the Image Service
section.para: After installing, you need to delete the sqlite database it creates, then change the configuration to point to the mysql database.
Delete the glance.sqlite file created in the /var/lib/glance/ directory.

section.title: Configuring the Image Service database backend
section.para: Configure the backend data store. For MySQL, create a glance MySQL database and a glance MySQL user. Grant the "glance" user full access to the glance MySQL database.
Start the MySQL command line client by running:
Enter the mysql root user's password when prompted.
To configure the MySQL database, create the glance database.
Create a MySQL user for the newly-created glance database that has full control of the database.

para.literallayout: mysql> GRANT ALL ON glance.* TO 'glance'@'%' IDENTIFIED BY 'yourpassword';

section.para: Enter quit at the mysql> prompt to exit MySQL.

section.title: Edit the Glance configuration files and paste ini middleware files
section.para: Update /etc/glance/glance-api-paste.ini, configure the admin_* values under [filter:authtoken].
section.screen: [filter:authtoken] admin_tenant_name = service admin_user = glance admin_password = glance
section.para: Add this to the end of /etc/glance/glance-api.conf.
Restart glance-api to pick up these changed settings.
Add this to the end of /etc/glance/glance-registry.conf.
Update /etc/glance/glance-registry-paste.ini, configure the admin_* vaules under [filter:authtoken]:
section.screen: [filter:authtoken] admin_tenant_name = service admin_user = glance admin_password = glance
service glance-registry restart && service glance-api restart

note.para: Any time you change the .conf files, restart the corresponding service.

section.para: The database tables are created when you restart glance-registry, so there is no need to run a database sync command.

note.para: Also note that this guide does not configure image caching, refer to http://glance.openstack.org for more information.
